Okay, I just wanted to say something here... once again, sorry if this comes off as bragging, but it's *just so cool!*

Not only does this What-If feature my favorite game, but it also features one of my favorite authors:

> 
> Author Michael Carroll has done a lot of thinking about planetary atmospheres, and his book Drifting on Alien Winds vividly describes of what it would be like to descend through Jupiter's clouds. He was also kind enough to answer some of my questions about Jupiter. Here's a rough sketch of what you'd see as you descended through the clouds; for more, definitely check out his book.

I met Michael Carroll once or twice, and he actually signed my copy of "Drifting on Alien Winds" and drew a little picture of the Jovian clouds on there. For those who don't know, he created paintings depicting various space missions before digital art was a thing. He wanted to make his paintings as accurate as possible, so he began researching planetary features and atmospheres. Now, he knows more than almost anyone else about the atmospheres of planets and moons. If you haven't heard of "Drifting on Alien Winds," *buy it*. It will make you feel very smart and it will support a fantastic artist who should be a household name...

-Upsilon
